head.title: World Briefing | Europe: Britain: Police Send Poisoning Case To Prosecutors

hedline.hl1: World Briefing | Europe: Britain: Police Send Poisoning Case To Prosecutors

abstract.p: British police hand their findings in poisoning death of former KGB agent, Alexander V Litvinenko, to Crown Prosecution Service, which will determine whether suspects should be charged (S)

block.p: The British police handed their findings in the poisoning death of a former K.G.B. agent to the Crown Prosecution Service, which will determine whether suspects should be charged. The former agent, Alexander V. Litvinenko, died in London in November after ingesting a high dose of the radioactive isotope polonium 210. The British police have traveled to Moscow to interview people who met with Mr. Litvinenko on the day he is believed to have been poisoned, but they have persistently denied poisoning him.

The British police handed their findings in the poisoning death of a former K.G.B. agent to the Crown Prosecution Service, which will determine whether suspects should be charged. The former agent, Alexander V. Litvinenko, died in London in November after ingesting a high dose of the radioactive isotope polonium 210. The British police have traveled to Moscow to interview people who met with Mr. Litvinenko on the day he is believed to have been poisoned, but they have persistently denied poisoning him.
